Yes, attitudes towards drug use have certainly shifted since the 1960s. Today, some drugs like marijuana are legal for medical or recreational use in some states and countries, while others like opioids and other prescription drugs are regulated more strictly.

Throughout history, drug use has been a contentious issue, often tied to broader social and political debates. While drug use is still a complex and divisive issue, there is a growing recognition of the need to approach it with a more nuanced and evidence-based perspective, particularly in light of the opioid epidemic and other health crises related to addiction.

There is also greater recognition of the role that drug use can play in expanding consciousness and promoting alternative spiritual and therapeutic practices. As such, drugs like psilocybin, MDMA, and other psychedelics are being studied increasingly for their potential therapeutic benefits in the treatment of depression, addiction, and other mental health disorders.
